parallel.distributed

Class DSendMsg

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.distributed.DSendMsg
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, DMsgIntf

    public class DSendMsg
extends java.lang.Object
implements DMsgIntf
    implements a wrapper object for a "sendData()" request from a (local/remote) thread that is transmitted via the socket wire to the parallel.distributed.DMsgPassingCoordinatorSrv. Not for use as part of the public API (despite the "public" status).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      sends the data and sends back to the JVM's thread that connected to the server, via the same socket an parallel.distributed.OKReply object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DSendMsg

        public DSendMsg(int fromid,
        java.io.Serializable data,
        java.lang.String coordName)
        wraps a sendData(fromid) request -i.e. don't care who the receiver is.
        Parameters:
        fromid - int
        data - Serializable data to send
        coordName - String the name of the coordinator to be used by the server.

      • DSendMsg

        public DSendMsg(int fromid,
        int toid,
        java.io.Serializable data,
        java.lang.String coordName)
        wraps a sendData(fromid, tiid) request -i.e. only send data from this sender who declared their tid is fromid, to a thread that will declare their tid to be toid.
        Parameters:
        fromid - int
        toid - int
        data - Serializable data to send
        coordName - String the name of the coordinator to be used by the server.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public void execute(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
             throws java.io.IOException,
                    ParallelException
        sends the data and sends back to the JVM's thread that connected to the server, via the same socket an parallel.distributed.OKReply object.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface DMsgIntf
        Parameters:
        oos - ObjectOutputStream
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        ParallelException
